lines: Be on your guard. There are many enemies in these parts.
Keep a safe camp at night, and stay out of the shadows.
We Rangers remember the ancient lore of the West. We have ways to walk unseen.
Beware the wretched Morgul-scum that crawls out at night.
The wolf that one hears is worse than the Orc that one fears.
Be wary, many new dangers have arisen in these dark days.
Lonely folk are we, Rangers of the wild, hunters - but hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy.
The servants of the Enemy are found in many places, not in Mordor only.
In time of need, we will ride to the aid of Isildur's heir.
The numbers of our company grow few as of late.
The men of the west are faltering, but so long as I draw breath I will defend our people.
It is unsafe in the wilds, you never know when you are being hunted.
Watch your back in the wilderness.
There have been foul airs on the wind of late.
What tidings do you carry?
There is a cold darkness coming down onto the realms of Men.
I have seen with my eyes the ruin of Annúminas, where once was our capital city.
In my heart, #p, I still dream of a day when the Dúnedain are to be united.
Oh how I wish we could have seen Arnor in its splendour - now there are only ruins and tombs.
May your cloak keep you dry, #p.
The wilds can be rough and unforgiving
The weather can be harsh but the orcs are fouler.
I hope this weather clears up soon.
The weather may be wet and cold but it makes good cover against enemies unseen.
These clouds gives spead to the foul creatures of the dark.
Well met Captain #p!
Greetings Captain!
What news do you bring, #p?

lines: You are not a spy of the enemy are you?
Will you join us in our fight against the foul forces growing in these lands?
I am wary to trust you, many spies have been seen in these parts.
These are dark times, you never know who you can trust.
Are you friend or foe?

lines: My kin has long guarded these lands from the dangers that lie to the North.
As long as we watch over these lands, travellers such as you will be able to travel in peace.
Beware of the ancient wights and shades that roam this land. It is said they can take over your body.
Our homes, such as we have, are here in the North.
Be wary of the Ettenmoors, trolls have been seen coming down from the mountains.
Were it not for us, these lands would have fallen to the darkness long ago.
These lands are my domain, and I do all in my power to safeguard them.
It is not for nothing that we watch these lands. Many foul beasts nest here.
What brings you to this wilderness.
We Rangers have watched over these lands for generations lost to memory.
Long have we guarded these lands.
Our once great kingdom ruled over these lands.
In the days of old our cities sprawled across these lands, now our cities are but rubble and our people scattered.
Only we remember the glory of Arnor.
Our people have protected these lands for centuries.
This used to be the Kingdom of Arnor before it fell, now we are all that is left of our once great kingdom.
These lands were a great kingdom in days of old, but those days have long passed by...
No one but us remembers the great kingdom that once ruled these lands long ago...
If you head north up the Greenway you will end up at the ruins of Fornost Erain, the Norbury of Kings. At its height it was a great city of Arnor, now it is just a memory of our fallen Kingdom.
Have you seen the ruins of Amon Sûl? They are just south of here and make a good camp.
Weathertop is just south of here. It was known as the watchtower of Amon Sûl back in the days of our Old-Kingdom.

I hear the watchtower of Amon Sûl once held a palantír during the days of Arnor. It was lost when King Arvedui drowned with it in the Icebay of Forochel. He should have listened to the forewarning of the Snowmen.
The once great city of Annúminas was built in these hills, it was the first capital of the Kingdom of Arnor.

lines: Were it not for us, these lands would have fallen to the darkness long ago.
These lands are my domain, and I do all in my power to safeguard them.
Long have we guarded these .
From the shadows we protect these lands.
The halflings may not be particularly fond of us, but from a distance we are their guardians.
Riders in black cloaks have been seen around these parts.
We fight hard to keep these lands under peace.
The halfings live a simple life under the watchful eyes of the Dúnedain.
It has been hard to protect these lands since we were chased out of Sarn Ford.
These folk know not of the dangers growing outside their lands.
Foul folk have grown interest in these lands.
Foul folk have been coming into Bree.
Do not trust the robbers wandering around the Bree-lands.
The folk of Bree are wary of us, but we mean them no harm.
Many of the folk that dwell here consider us bandits and outcasts. They do not know our true duties.

lines: These are the lands of our kin, though many of the folk here seem to have forgotten that.
The men of Gondor have little respect for us Rangers of the North.
The stewards of Gondor will never accept Isildur's heir as the rightful king.
The Dúnedain of the north and south were once unified, now news of these lands rarely reach us.
The men of Gondor are our last defense unless the dark lands of Mordor.
One day Isildur's heir will rule as king over these lands and our people will be united once again.
I have hope for the men of Gondor who stand against the armies of Mordor.
In Ithilien there are Gondorians like us, who guard the wilderness as rangers.
Gondor. The southern kingdom of the Dúnedain.
Gondor was once a close ally with Arnor before our kingdom fell.
Lord Elrond is a gracious host for welcoming us into his lands.
The Dúnedain of the north and the elves of Imladris have always had close ties.
Rivendell. The last homely house of elves east of the sea
Few places in Middle-Earth are as beautiful as this.
The elves of Rivendell are very welcoming.
Rivendell is home to many relics of our people, such as the shards of Narsil, the sword which cut the ring from Sauron's hand.
Many of the elves here were there to witness our kingdom fall.
The loremasters of Imladris carry much knowledge of the Númenorians, our ancestors.
You are lucky to be welcome in this lands, #p.
Elrond holds the Sceptre of Annúminas, a relic of our kings of old until the coming of Isildur's heir.
Rivendell has many books about the history on the old Kingdom of Arnor.
I advise stopping at the inn of the Prancing Pony before returning to the wilds, #p.
The black riders that attacked Sarn Ford came here into Bree, these are dark times #p.
Watch your back, #p, Bree has been filled with unsavory folk as of late.
I wonder what interest these spies have in Bree.
Foul folk from the south have been coming into Bree.
We are being watched #p, do not say too much.
Reports say Bree has been filled with spies as of late.

lines: Long have we guarded these lands, #p.
What brings you to this wilderness, #p?
It is not for nothing that we watch these lands, #p. Many foul beasts nest here.
As long as we watch over these lands, travellers such as you will be able to travel in peace, #p.
Beware of the ancient wights and shades that roam this land, #p. It is said they can take over your body.
These lands are my domain, #p, and I do all in my power to safeguard them.
The people here know not what lies outsides their borders.
We rangers protect these lands from afar.
I will make sure no danger enters these lands.
May your journey be swift and your cloak warm, #p.
Beware the wretched Morgul-scum that crawls out at night, #p.
Be wary, #p. Many new dangers have arisen in these dark days.
I am gladdened to know you are not a servent of the enemy, #p!
May your steps be light and your cloak hide you, #p.
Good day, #p. From which land do you hail?
Good day, #p!
By nightfall this land will be crawling with Orcs.
Well met #p! Do you bear any news?
Bree was attacked by Black Riders, the same whom attacked the rangers at Sarn Ford. These are dark times.
Be wary if you head into Bree, spies and robbers have been moving into those parts.
Greetings #p, do you carry any news of our kin to the south?
Every day more orcs come down from the mountains.
Our enemy is rising, #p.
News has it that orcs have filled Isengard, it seems Saruman is now amongst our enemy.
The hillmen of the north have been growing in numbers as of late.
Our old enemy in the north is growing, #p.
Have you heard any news from the south?
Be wary of our tombs #p, they have been cursed.
Rider of Rohan! What news from the mark?
Rumors are that orcs have been pillaging your lands bearing the White Hand. Is it true then, has Saruman betrayed us?
Robbers and spys have been making their way up The Greenway from the Gap of Rohan and settling in Bree, do you know of this?
Greetings #p, Rider of Rohan.
I have heard King Théoden has been poisoned, is this true?
Mae govannen, #p.
Ai! What news from the Elves?
Mae govannen mellon nín.
I have heard a single bite of lembas can fill the stomach of a grown man!
Tales of Black Riders have been heard throughout Eriador, I fear the Nazgûl of old may have returned.
Long have the elves stood by our people.
The splendor of the elves is always welcome among the Dúnedain.
Do you feel it? Do you feel the darkness growing throughout Middle-Earth?
Will you stand by the heir of Isildur when he comes into your realm?
Well met, #p! What news of our kin to the south?
Rumours are that mercenaries from the south have begun raiding the coasts of Gondor!
The stewards cannot stand against the heir of Isildur's claim to the throne.
Have you seen the shards of Narsil? They are held in Rivendell.
Gondor is our last stand against the armies of Mordor.
We are the last memory of the west.
Together, the Men of the West stand against the servants of enemy.
Well met, how goes the Dúnedain of the South?
I hear the view from Minas Tirith is a sight to see.
Greetings, #p! How goes the fight against Mordor?
I hear the Rangers of Ithilien have been having trouble with the Haradrim from the South.
The Lossoth harboured the last king of our old kingdom, and for that they have our thanks.
Greetings! How have the Snowmen of Forochel been faring through the harsh winters?
The Rangers are accustomed to the wilderness, but to live in the frozen wastes of the north is brave of you, #p.
Well met, #p. How goes the people of Forodwaith?
I hear the Lossoth live in huts of snow, your perseverance against the cold winter is admirable.
Without your people, an heirloom of our house, the Ring of Barahir would have been lost to the sea.
Long ago, your people harboured Arvedui, our last king from the dangers of the Witch-King.
Do not trust those ruffians, #p. They are spies of the enemy.
We guard the wilderness surrounding your lands.
Fear not of our people, we may not look fair, but we mean you no harm.
Be wary of the Barrow-Downs, a foul curse lies on our ancient tombs.
Be cautious in Bree, a lot of unsavory folk have been coming in from the south.
I hear Black Riders have been in Bree? Things are worse then you could possibly realize.

lines: I feel a deep dread in my heart, we should not linger here.
Beware the wretched Morgul-scum that scour these lands.
It is not safe here #p.
The servants of the enemy are many in these lands.
These lands are shrouded in an unnatural darkness.
I would not dare wander here willingly, you are braver than I #p.
The enemy would have all of Middle-Earth shrouded in this darkness.
These lands are crawling with orcs.
Never have felt such fear as I do in these lands, tread carefully.
This place makes the wilderness feel inviting.
I would rather be anywhere but in these foul lands.
I should never have come into this lands.
I am eager to return to the wilds of Eriador.
It is against this darkness which we swear to fight.
This is no place for men.
The air feels toxic here.
I wish to flee from these accursed lands.
This is the kingdom of Angmar, our ancient enemy.
In the olden days of our kingdom, the Witch-King of Angmar commanded his forces from these accursed lands.
I thought the kingdom of Angmar was all but abandoned, I am disheartened to know that the enemy has returned.
The men of these lands were once part of our kingdom, now they are servants of the enemy.
My duty is to my captain #p and the lands over which I stand guard.
The Morgul-filth of the night shall perish before us!
I have sworn to defend the lands of the free peoples, and defend them I shall!
May your journey be swift and your cloak warm, captain #p.
By nightfall this land will be crawling with Orcs.
Be on your guard, captain #p. There are many enemies in these parts.
We Rangers remember the ancient lore of the West. We have ways to walk unseen.
The wolf that one hears is worse than the Orc that one fears.
We Rangers have ways to move unseen and unheard.
I will follow you wherever you go!
I have ways to move unseen in the shadows.
Let's hunt some Orc!
I fight for memory of The West, #p.
You are a true friend of the Dúnedain, #p.
We shall follow you through death and ruin!
The wretched Morgul-scum shall face our wrath!
Ruin to all the enemies of the Dúnedain!
We should keep to the shadows, #p.

lines: You are not welcome in these lands, #p!
Flee our lands, you wretched ally of the Morgul-filth!
We Rangers have watched over these lands for generations lost to memory, we will not let them fall to the likes of you!
Flee these lands, #p! You are not welcome here!
I will not leave these lands unguarded. Flee filfth!
These lands are protected by the last of Dúnedain!
Begone from these lands!

lines: I will not allow you to harm the free folk of these lands!
I will protect the life of these folk to my dying breath!
The halflings will not bear any of your treachery!
These lands are my domain! I will do all in my power to protect them!
Do not think these lands are unprotected, #p!
These lands are protected by the Rangers of the North!
Our people may be scattered but we stand together against you!
Go back to your wretched hole, servant of the enemy!
We will not let the memory of the west fade!
The men of the west stand against you!
Your death shall come swift as the arrow that pierces flesh, #p!
I shall make an end of you!
You will not be missed, #p!
You are an enemy of the race of Men, #p!
What madness led you here?
Crawl back into the night, #p!
You thought you could match our skill? You are sorely mistaken!
When did #p forsake reason for madness?
Your doom approaches, #p!
Do not underestimate the Rangers of the North.
Go back to the darkness whence you came!
What devilry of the Dark Lord do you bring here?
You shall meet your doom swiftly, scum of Mordor!
